metadata.description: Goal insights with supporting facts for interactive interface

insights.title: Exceptional High Values: General Practice
insights.narrative: General Practice demonstrates exceptionally high patients values in Department Referral, Department Referral, representing a significant positive outlier that stands apart from typical patterns.

supporting_facts.description: In the Bar showing patients across all categories in Department Referral, General Practice stands out with a value of 1840.0, which is 2.2 standard deviations above the mean of 545.1.
In the Bar showing patients by Department Referral, General Practice has the highest value at 1840.0, which is 238% above the average of 545.1.

insights.title: Inverse Performance Pattern: Not Adimitted
insights.narrative: Not Adimitted shows an inverse relationship between wait time and score: high in wait time but low in score, indicating these measures capture different aspects of performance.

supporting_facts.description: In the Bar showing wait time by Patient Admission Flag, Not Adimitted has the highest value at 35.6, which is 1% above the average of 35.3.
In the Bar showing score by Patient Admission Flag, Not Adimitted has the lowest value at 4.9, which is 2% below the average of 5.0.

insights.title: Inverse Performance Pattern: Adimitted
insights.narrative: Adimitted shows an inverse relationship between wait time and score: low in wait time but high in score, indicating these measures capture different aspects of performance.

supporting_facts.description: In the Bar showing wait time by Patient Admission Flag, Adimitted has the lowest value at 35.0, which is 1% below the average of 35.3.
In the Bar showing score by Patient Admission Flag, Adimitted has the highest value at 5.1, which is 2% above the average of 5.0.

insights.title: Relationship between wait time and score
insights.narrative: wait time and score show no linear correlation (r=-0.02).

insights.title: Exceptional Dimensional Behavior: Adimitted
insights.narrative: Adimitted demonstrates exceptional behavior in the dimensional interaction between Patient Admission Flag and admission_day, standing out from typical interaction patterns.

supporting_facts.description: In the Bar showing patients by Patient Admission Flag, Adimitted has the highest value at 4612.0, which is 0% above the average of 4608.0.
In the Bar showing patients by Patient Admission Flag, Adimitted has the highest value at 4612.0, which is 0% above the average of 4608.0.
In the Bar showing 08-12 by admission_time, Adimitted has the lowest value at 762.0, which is 0% below the average of 763.0.
In the Bar showing Wednesday by Patient Admission Flag, Adimitted has the lowest value at 629.0, which is 0% below the average of 630.0.
Across all series in the Bar comparing patients by Patient Admission Flag, the lowest value overall is 629.0 for Wednesday in the Adimitted category, which is 4% below the overall average.

insights.title: Exceptional Dimensional Behavior: White
insights.narrative: White demonstrates exceptional behavior in the dimensional interaction between Patient Race and Patient Age, standing out from typical interaction patterns.

supporting_facts.description: In the Bar showing Male by Patient Race, White has the highest value at 1296.0, which is 93% above the average of 672.1.

In the Bar comparing patients across Patient Race, the White category shows the most pronounced disparities between series with a standard deviation of 602.55, which is 2.3x higher than the average disparity in other categories. The gap ranges from NC (5.0) to Male (1296.0).

In the Bar comparing patients across Patient Race, the White category shows the most pronounced disparities between series with a range of 1291.0 units for the absolute range, which is 2.3x higher than the average disparity in other categories. The gap ranges from NC (5.0) to Male (1296.0).
Across all series in the Bar comparing patients by Patient Race, the highest value overall is 1296.0 for Male in the White category, which is 195% above the overall average.
In the Bar showing patients by Patient Race, White has the highest value at 2571.0, which is 95% above the average of 1316.6.
In the Bar showing 60-69 by Patient Race, White has the highest value at 327.0, which is 98% above the average of 164.9.
Across all series in the Bar comparing patients by Patient Race, the highest value overall is 348.0 for 20-29 in the White category, which is 111% above the overall average.

In the Bar comparing patients across Patient Race, the White category shows the most pronounced disparities between series with a range of 66.0 units for the absolute range, which is 1.8x higher than the average disparity in other categories. The gap ranges from 40-49 (282.0) to 20-29 (348.0).

In the Bar comparing patients across Patient Race, the White category shows the most pronounced disparities between series with a standard deviation of 17.44, which is 1.5x higher than the average disparity in other categories. The gap ranges from 40-49 (282.0) to 20-29 (348.0).

insights.title: Consistent Multi-Dimensional Performance: White
insights.narrative: White demonstrates consistent high patients value across multiple combinations of Patient Race and Patient Age.

supporting_facts.description: In the Bar showing Male by Patient Race, White has the highest value at 1296.0, which is 93% above the average of 672.1.
Across all series in the Bar comparing patients by Patient Race, the highest value overall is 1296.0 for Male in the White category, which is 195% above the overall average.
In the Bar showing patients by Patient Race, White has the highest value at 2571.0, which is 95% above the average of 1316.6.
In the Bar showing 60-69 by Patient Race, White has the highest value at 327.0, which is 98% above the average of 164.9.
Across all series in the Bar comparing patients by Patient Race, the highest value overall is 348.0 for 20-29 in the White category, which is 111% above the overall average.
